greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Lower triangular Fibonacci matrix, by SW antidiagonals.
link: Clark Kimberling, Fusion, Fission, and Factors, Fib. Q., 52 (2014), 195-202.
formula: Column n consists of n-1 zeros followed by the Fibonacci sequence (1,1,2,3,5,8,...).
mathematica: Flatten[Table[P[[i]][[k + 1 - i]], {k, 1, n}, {i, 1, k}]] (* A202451 as a sequence *)
Flatten[Table[Q[[i]][[k + 1 - i]], {k, 1, n}, {i, 1, k}]] (* A202452 as a sequence *)
Flatten[Table[F[[i]][[k + 1 - i]], {k, 1, n}, {i, 1, k}]] (* A202453 as a sequence *)
TableForm[Q]  (* A202451, upper triangular Fibonacci array *)
TableForm[P]  (* A202452, lower triangular Fibonacci array *)
results.author: _Clark Kimberling_, Dec 19 2011
